intro: Polysphaeria multiflora subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy polysphaeria, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its pubescent (hairy) leaves, which provide a unique texture and aid in water retention. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
